short_message: 'The media is one of the most powerful entities in a democratic setup. They have the power to make the innocent look guilty and to make the guilty look
message:
'The media is one of the most powerful entities in a democratic setup. They have the power to make the innocent look guilty and to make the guilty look innocent, and that's their power. Because they control the minds of the masses.' These sentiments echoed by Malcolm X have been proved many a time. But unfortunately, in recent times media outlets are not dedicated to what they should actually be looking for- ethics and truthfulness. Lots of instances can be cited which suggest that media is running recklessly after sensationalism and profit, which sadly, is directly proportional to how one can engage the common people with a spicy gossip. This has led media tending to report rumors, speculations, and projections as facts and in turn, misleading the major chunk of masses into believing them.
A recent news in a leading newspaper daily stating that IITBHU would be providing training to become ideal daughter-in-law shook us. Although the news garnered a lot of mass attention and surely helped the media houses gain its warranted popularity, but at what cost? Defaming an institution of national importance can never be justified on grounds of a false news. IIT BHU director had to convene a meeting with the top officials regarding the news and the institute has sent the clarification to all the media houses. A startup which was incubated at IIT BHU was taking some steps and the reporter thought it necessary to highlight it as an IIT BHU initiative so as to get the attention of masses. (Link to the report: https://www.dnaindia.com/... )
IITs, being the premier institutes of India, have been a sought-after topic of news reporting for the media. The status of IITs as mere screening institutes for providing jobs after a few years of study has been created thanks to media highlighting only about the highly paid jobs here. The hype that has been created around IITs being such institutes have cost the nation its research potential and reputation has been compromised. It's high time that we stand against such ways of news reporting and believe in constructive journalism.

short_message: 'One child, one teacher, one pen and one book can change the world', a quote by an activist for women education and the daughter of a teacher, Malala Yousafzai.
message:
'One child, one teacher, one pen and one book can change the world', a quote by an activist for women education and the daughter of a teacher, Malala Yousafzai.

Rightly so, a teacher constantly fights to bring out the best in his students. He is the one who does not bid his pupil to enter the house of his wisdom rather leads them to the threshold of their minds.

To fathom the pre-eminence of teachers in our lives the birth anniversary of Dr Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, the 5th of September is celebrated as Teacher's Day all over the country with great enthusiasm. He was a legendary teacher, first vice president and second President of India. Widely recognised and respected as one of the 20th century’s most respected Indian thinkers, he wasn’t just a teacher.
Awaaz wishes all a very Happy Teacher's Day.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
short_message: On the eve of Janmashtami, various halls celebrated the birth anniversary of Lord Krishna with astounding enthusiasm. Different halls of residence including
message:
On the eve of Janmashtami, various halls celebrated the birth anniversary of Lord Krishna with astounding enthusiasm. Different halls of residence including RP, RK, Patel, and BRH organized Intra-hall Matki Phod competition. The event started with the interaction program as a step towards the welfare of the students and building the community, which received immense participation and support from all boarders irrespective of year. In the loud, rocking music and continuous showers of water, students constantly kept their tempo high to break 'Dahi Handi' hanged high, firstly year wise, then wing wise and at last, all together. Everyone fought hard to break Dahi handi and in the process, enjoyed a lot. Gifts were also distributed at the end. Along with these events, Antaakshari competition added the extra charm of music and joy. With the aim to enhance community building and student welfare, increase bonding and interaction among students, the event was a huge success.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciate the efforts of all halls and consider this initiative as a great step in building a healthy and positive atmosphere among student community in the present situation.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 15 new photos — with Rupak Thakur and 8 others.
short_message:
Teacher's Day Celebration 2018
Teacher's Day celebration took place in the campus on 2nd of September. The day witnessed the most bright start with
message:
Teacher's Day Celebration 2018
Teacher's Day celebration took place in the campus on 2nd of September. The day witnessed the most bright start with sketching competition organized for school children, the venue being Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence whose students had arranged the celebration. Then came the evening of Teachers' Day celebration at Kalidas Auditorium which witnessed commendable participation from the students and the professors. It was an honor for IIT Kharagpur to have Indian Folk Exponent, Kalpana Patowary, who had lightened the closing ceremony of Commonwealth Games 2018 and sang in an album by The Coke Studio. During the event, she sang songs in various dialects like Bengali and Bhojpuri and also sang her own song which had been released by Coke Studio. Prof. Joy Sen played a piece on Sitar and Prof. Anandrup Bhattacharya sang classical Bollywood songs that echoed the auditorium with their melody. Various cultural events performed by the students of Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence drove through the evening that comprised of various dance performances; one was themed 'Expressionless' which was of a comic and lyrical genre. A rock and roll style dance performance, which was filled with a plethora of striking moments and twists, left the audience awestruck. A drama titled '9 reasons why you should have stayed home sick today' was presented which added an element of fun to the evening. Elocution by two students and a music performance also added to the celebration.

short_message: Lord Krishna’s life has had a profound impact on Indian culture, philosophy and civilization. Janmashtami is celebrated with all fervor and heightened
message: Lord Krishna’s life has had a profound impact on Indian culture, philosophy and civilization. Janmashtami is celebrated with all fervor and heightened spirits throughout the country, marking the birth anniversary of Lord Krishna, who is believed to be an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. Spreading gleeful vibes with Little Krishna’s acts of innocence, Awaaz IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a very Happy Janmashtami.

short_message: Ever wondered that how IIT Kharagpur was in the early years of its foundation? KGP back then, 60 years ago. The same place lightened up by different students,
message:
Ever wondered that how IIT Kharagpur was in the early years of its foundation? KGP back then, 60 years ago. The same place lightened up by different students, with its historic Hijli jail as the main building, no girl population in the campus, the prevalent ragging culture and a lot more. With the curiosity to travel back in time, here begins the series “Reminiscing about the GOOD OLD DAYS!”, where Captain Mohan Ram I.N (retired) class of 1958 IIT Kharagpur has penned a light-hearted account of IIT in early days. He was also the Vice President, TSG for 1957-58.
http://www.gymkhana.iitkg...

If you too want to submit your article for Gymkhana blog, visit the blog and click on the 'Publish Your Blog' at the right margin of the webpage. (or visit: http://www.gymkhana.iitkg... )

message:
Having a lot of pent-up ideas and opinions regarding the recently conducted first ever 'Assimilation Programme' whooping around your head but lacking a platform to express them? Here is an opportunity for you to voice out your experience, suggestions and opinions regarding the same. Selected articles will be published from the page. Anonymity, if requested, will be taken care of.

short_message: With the aim to provoke rethink on the modes of societal governance and law, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSoIPL), IIT Kharagpur
message:
With the aim to provoke rethink on the modes of societal governance and law, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSoIPL), IIT Kharagpur has developed a one-semester inter-disciplinary course titled 'Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Law'. It addresses the paradigm shifts that are occurring due to the intense involvement of AI as autonomous systems that can possibly invent, participate in inventions, create new expressions like music, paintings, and raising sensitive questions on inventorship, authorship, ownership of patents, copyright, designs.
Weaving AI into its curriculum, RGSoIPL has pioneered another change in Legal education becoming only law school in the country with a technological focus.
Source:
https://www.business-stan...

short_message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the CIC officials responsible for wifi and LAN connections.

CIC reported a power drop today which has not been
message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the CIC officials responsible for wifi and LAN connections.

CIC reported a power drop today which has not been entirely restored. They are using some substitute power supply which could provide connection to at least some students if not all.
CIC has reported that they have already received many complaints and are still working on it.
The problem they are facing presently is that the current power supply is not able to provide connection to the entire campus which is why they have requested to reduce the number of user connections per unit time.
'The issue will be hopefully resolved by tonight', said the CIC officials.

story: Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.
short_message:
Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.

Hey there,
Just like every year, this weekend, KOSS is going to organise
message:
Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.

Hey there,
Just like every year, this weekend, KOSS is going to organise Python Programming classes. Python is a general-purpose language, which means it can be used to build just about anything. Python helps you to work in various fields such as - Data Mining, Machine Learning, Data Analysis, Web Development and more seamlessly.

These programming classes can be stepping stones for students who want to pursue a career in Software Development or Data Science. The classes are going to be conducted on 1st and 2nd of September '18 (Saturday and Sunday). Event details are as follow -

Venue: Nalanda NC-231
Date: 1st-2nd Sep 2018
Time: From 3 PM
Register at - http://bit.ly/kosspc18

Make sure you bring your laptop with you. Also, it would be great if you have Python pre-installed.
Download python from - https://www.python.org/do... (3.x versions)

If you are new to programming, don't worry we have got that covered for you.

short_message: Dhyan Chand Singh, a renowned personality in the International Hockey arena, had a phenomenal 22 years of sports career with 400 goals and 3 gold medals
message:
Dhyan Chand Singh, a renowned personality in the International Hockey arena, had a phenomenal 22 years of sports career with 400 goals and 3 gold medals in Olympics for India. To celebrate his birthday and to keep the sporting spirit high in the country, 29th August is celebrated as the National Sports Day.
India’s most dedicated sportsperson, a true patriot, an inspiration to many, we bow down before this legend as well as all the sportspersons and pledge to keep the Indian flag high forever.

short_message: Maryam Mirzakhani, the first and only woman to win the Fields Medal, achieved what any woman, even from the most progressive countries is yet to. She overcame
message:
Maryam Mirzakhani, the first and only woman to win the Fields Medal, achieved what any woman, even from the most progressive countries is yet to. She overcame everything that was to afflict a woman in Post-Revolution Iran. Today, IR Iran is a formidable force to reckon with in STEM, and with more than 70% of their STEM Graduates being women, Maryam Mirzakhani was both the harbinger of and a testament to this change.
Shreya Santra​, Editor (TSG), explores the almost fairytale-like life of this Mathematical Genius, which is also a tribute to her indomitable spirit. An inspirational biography for all the women who have ever fought and all the women who will fight for their rightful place in any domain.
http://www.gymkhana.iitkg...
Edited by: Ratnottam Das​, Editor (TSG)
If you too want to submit your article for Gymkhana blog, visit the blog and click on the 'Publish Your Blog' at the right margin of the webpage. (or visit: http://www.gymkhana.iitkg... )

short_message: Jugaad is probably one of the most casually used words, especially finding its way into conversations between students and most frequently thrown around
message:
Jugaad is probably one of the most casually used words, especially finding its way into conversations between students and most frequently thrown around before submissions and deadlines. It incorporates an ad-hoc approach meant to solve problems with immediate efficacy and represents innovative, albeit sometimes ephemeral, capabilities, but a deeper truth underlying this mentality suggests a darker side to it. We as Indians are famously known for our prowess in jugaad and it’s no coincidence that our progress towards development is encumbered with an increasing pace of problems piling up and a mismatch in the rate of sustainable solutions being offered. Recent times have seen some instrumental shifts in the momentum of our progress, but hidden to the collective eye is a sea of untapped potential that can possibly accelerate the same. Delineating this stand and carefully drawing the lines between frugality and jugaad, words that are often confused as the same, two of our distinguished alumni Prof. Aloke Kumar (2005|DD|MF+Industrial|RP), currently an Assistant Professor at IISC Bangalore, and Prof. Ranajay Ghosh (2004|B.Tech|ME|RP), currently an Assistant Professor at the University of Central Florida, explore this issue with prominent examples in an article they authored recently.

Disclaimer: The views and opinions presented by the authors in the article are theirs alone and do not necessarily reflect the same of The Scholar’s Avenue.

https://thedrashta.blogsp...

short_message:
“You can’t buy happiness but you can buy books and they are kind of the same thing”

But what if you didn’t have to buy them? What if you could
message:
“You can’t buy happiness but you can buy books and they are kind of the same thing”

But what if you didn’t have to buy them? What if you could just share one and find a friend in return?

IWG presents the event ‘Novel Exchange’ to set afoot this tradition. Let’s take this initiating step that’ll interweave Kgpian hearts. Come out with a book close to your heart which you’d like share and submit it. Receive another book that you’d like to read and enjoy. Meet the borrower or lender of your book to discuss it over a cup of chai or a walk around 2.2 and Congratulations, you now have two new friends!

Nominate your booklover friends to come out and do the same, there’s no better way to get those introverts out of their rooms.

Venue: Stalls in front of Gymkhana, CCD and MT

Bring a Book: 5-7 pm ; 22nd August (Wednesday)
Take a Book: 8-10 pm ; 23rd August (Thursday)

Agreement:

I hereby declare that I take full responsibility of taking care of the condition of this book and not tampering with it. I agree to return the book to its rightful owner by the third week of October. If I don’t meet the above requirements or lose the book by chance, I accept to face the consequences and return a sum of money chosen with propriety.

short_message: A settled family in Canada, along with a lucrative job of professorship in a renowned college is no doubt anything short of a woman’s dream life, but from
message:
A settled family in Canada, along with a lucrative job of professorship in a renowned college is no doubt anything short of a woman’s dream life, but from there to divorcing the husband and leaving all for rugged terrains in West Bengal to struggle for the downtrodden and underprivileged seems to be an unbelievable storyline of a movie. But fortunately yes, such a wonder woman does exist, and Hansa Nundy, an alumna of IIT Kharagpur is whom we are talking about.
“It is very easy to live for yourself”, says Hansa beaming with energy even in her 72nd year in her office room of the Disha Seema Centre School, a residential complex for children from underprivileged backgrounds to live, learn and eventually lead unto better lives. Read the full article here:
http://awaaziitkgp.org/di...

message: A talk on the life history of Netaji Subash Chandra Bose by author and former journalist Mr. Anuj Dhar is being organized by Samvad in the Kalidas Auditorium on 22nd August from 5 p.m. onwards. This talk would also witness the famous Bengali movie director, Mr. Srijit Mukherjee, as one of the guests, who also intend to make a movie on the enigma around the disappearance of Netaji.

short_message: In one of the major decisions taken at the IIT council meeting held in the capital on Tuesday, all IITs unanimously rejected the government-backed proposal
message:
In one of the major decisions taken at the IIT council meeting held in the capital on Tuesday, all IITs unanimously rejected the government-backed proposal to radically reform JEE advanced putting an end to all the speculations being proliferated about the examination.

The IIT council rejected both the ideas presented by the HRD ministry - of setting up an expert committee to make JEE advanced more scientific and to reduce dependence on coaching centres as well as the idea of changing the allocation system of selected students. The IITs also added that the current format has been working smoothly and any 'tinkering' with it was undesirable. Finally, the ministry also went with the IIT view that the need for reform must be driven by the institutions and should be bothered upon only when they feel the need for reforms.

Source -
https://economictimes.ind...

story: Technology Robotix Society shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
short_message:
Technology Robotix Society shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see
message:
Technology Robotix Society shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see https://en.wikipedia.org/... and http://www.niti.gov.in /) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach:
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.... . The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi ( http://movesummit.in /) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

short_message: Mr. Aneesh Reddy and Mr. Anant Choubey, two of our Alumni have proposed to set-up a Re-Water Research Center at IIT Kharagpur to replenish and rejuvenate
message:
Mr. Aneesh Reddy and Mr. Anant Choubey, two of our Alumni have proposed to set-up a Re-Water Research Center at IIT Kharagpur to replenish and rejuvenate water resources. The pilot plant, which is expected to be set-up by March 2019, will convert 1.35 million of litres of sewage water from the hostels to 1.2 million litres of potable water, on a daily basis. Quality assurance tests will also be conducted to demonstrate the suitability of the treated water for consumption and also to infuse confidence among public and other agencies about technology related to sewage water treatment. Mr. Aneesh Reddy told that ‘The Aditya Choubey Center for Re-Water Research’ would be networking with the government bodies to take up this technology and the process and meet the water challenge in various cities. The idea is to simultaneously tackle the problems of scarcity of clean water for domestic use and massive sewage problems in urban areas. “The project is being developed to attract potential entrepreneurs and government agencies to take up sewage treatment at a large scale and with a business model for banks to gain confidence in funding such businesses,” said Mr. Anant Choubey.

Source - https://timesofindia.indi...

short_message: 'It is not the beauty of a building you should look at; its the construction of the foundation that will stand the test of time.' - David Allan Coe
message:
'It is not the beauty of a building you should look at; its the construction of the foundation that will stand the test of time.' - David Allan Coe

IIT Kharagpur was founded as a part of Jawaharlal Nehru’s far-sighted dream to have a free self-reliant India in 1951. Driven by such an ambitious vision, the institute has come a long way today with enormous developments and incessant growth in every aspect celebrating its 68th Institute Foundation Day.

short_message: After having 67 years of stupendous journey of perpetual growth and excellence, the 68th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur was celebrated today at Netaji
message: After having 67 years of stupendous journey of perpetual growth and excellence, the 68th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur was celebrated today at Netaji Auditorium. It was graced by the propitious presence of the Chief Guest Purnendu Chatterjee himself being an institute alumnus and  Executive Director of Indian School of Business (ISB), Hyderabad and the Director Dr. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti. Awards from different categories like Staff Excellence Award, Nina Saxena Technology Excellence Award, Faculty Excellence Award as well as the  Chair Professorship was conferred. Also, the Young Alumni Achiever Awards were presented to young and promising alumni who have achieved great success and recognition in their chosen profession. The event also witnessed an adorable gesture of giving mementos to the alumni who have reached KGP to attend the homecoming. The event concluded with a vote of thanks from the registrar on behalf of the institute.

short_message: Amidst the damage & havoc caused by unprecedented floods in Kerala- what stands out is the grit and commitment of young IAS officers leading teams for
message:
Amidst the damage & havoc caused by unprecedented floods in Kerala- what stands out is the grit and commitment of young IAS officers leading teams for relief and restoration operations. Mr. Raja Gopal Sunkara (IAS), Sub-Collector of Padmamabapuram has been on the job in the field helping out each and every soul. Raja Gopal Sunkara also happens to be an IIT Kharagpur Alumnus, Dual Degree Agricultural & Food Engineering of the batch of 2012, later IAS (2014) and now Sub Collector and Sub-Divisional Magistrate, Padmanabhapuram tirelessly working in flood-hit South India, especially Kerala.
He has requested our vast network of Alumni and students to generously contribute to Kerala in the following ways:
1. Donate to The CM's Disaster Relief Fund (CMDRF)
Online: www.donation.cmdrf.kerala... /

short_message: अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी जी के निधन पर आईआईटी खड़गपुर के मुख्य प्रांगण में शाम को  छः बजे देश के महान नायक को श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित की गई। अटल जी को श्रद्धांजलि
message:
अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी जी के निधन पर आईआईटी खड़गपुर के मुख्य प्रांगण में शाम को छः बजे देश के महान नायक को श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित की गई। अटल जी को श्रद्धांजलि देने के लिए उनके चित्र पर पुष्प अर्पित किये गए व मोमबत्ती जलाकर उनकी आत्मा की शांति की मनोकामना की गई। इस अवसर पर काफी लोगों ने अपनी उपस्थिति दर्ज की। अटल जी के सम्मान में उपस्थित लोगों ने अपने विचार व्यक्त किये व उनके देशहित में किये गए कार्यों को याद किया गया। कुछ लोगों ने अपनी कविताओं के माध्यम से अटल जी को उन्ही के कवि अंदाज में याद किया। इस अवसर उपस्थित संचालकों ने कहा कि हमें उनके जीवन से बहुत कुछ सीखना चाहिये, उनके जैसे देशप्रेमी स्वंयसेवक
की क्षतिपूर्ती असंभव है। यदि हम उनके विचारों को अपने जीवन में उतारें तो हम देश को एक नई ऊँचाई तक ले जा सकते। उपस्थित जनसमूह ने अटल जी के दिखाये हुए पथ पर चलने का संकल्प लिया।
आवाज़ आईआईटी खड़गपुर जननायक अटल जी की आत्मा की शांति की कामना करते हैं।

short_message: India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see https://en.wikipedia.org/... and
message:
India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see https://en.wikipedia.org/... and http://www.niti.gov.in /) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach:
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.... . The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi ( http://movesummit.in /) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

'Dear All,

You are aware that Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee, our ex-Prime Minister, passed away yesterday. In
message:
An appeal from the Director,
'Dear All,

You are aware that Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee, our ex-Prime Minister, passed away yesterday. In view of this, I am requesting that at 11 am, all of us have a solemn remembrance by observing a Two-Minute Silence with prayers for his soul journey and his dreams for our nation's good be fulfilled. This may be observed in the respective places where we are, classrooms of the ongoing classes, in departments, centres, schools, units, offices, etc., wherever possible in a convenient manner and appropriate ambience. Your kind cooperation in this regard is solicited.

Regards
PPC'
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the student community to kindly observe the two-minute silence and pay their regards to our beloved Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

short_message:
'मौत की उमर क्या है? दो पल भी नहीं,
ज़िन्दगी सिलसिला, आज कल की नहीं।

मैं जी भर जिया, मैं मन से मरूँ,
लौटकर आऊँगा, कूच से क्यों
message:
'मौत की उमर क्या है? दो पल भी नहीं,
ज़िन्दगी सिलसिला, आज कल की नहीं।

मैं जी भर जिया, मैं मन से मरूँ,
लौटकर आऊँगा, कूच से क्यों डरूँ? '

आज एक युग का अंत हो गया- भारतवर्ष के किसी एक राजनीतिक अध्याय का ही नहीं, बल्कि समग्र राष्ट्र की ओजस्विता के अध्याय का भी। भारत-रत्न स्वर्गीय अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी के निधन ने सम्पूर्ण राष्ट्र को शोक-सागर में डुबो दिया है। तीन बार देश के प्रधानमंत्री रह चुके वाजपेयीजी एक आदर्श राजनेता थे जिनकी राजनीति दलगत कभी रही ही नहीं, क्योंकि वे पूरे देश को एक साथ लेकर चलना जानते थे। संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघ में हिंदी में अपना वक्तृत्त्व देने वाले वे पहले राष्ट्र-प्रतिनिधि थे। वे एक कुशल एवं ओजस्वी वक्ता, प्रख्यात कवि एवं आदर्श पत्रकार थे, जिनका हर शब्द देश की जनता के दिल में घर कर जाता था। यही कारण है कि परमाणु परीक्षण, कारगिल युद्ध, या संसद हमले जैसे कठिन समय में भी उन्होंने कुशलता से राष्ट्र का संचालन किया और सभी पार्टियों को एक सूत्र में बाँधे रखा। स्वतंत्र भारत के राजनीतिक इतिहास में वाजपेयीजी शायद ऐसे एकमात्र राजनेता हैं जिन्हें पक्ष और विपक्ष, दोनों का समान भाव से आदर और प्रेम मिला। कारण बहुत सहज है- उनके लिए देश किसी व्यक्ति, समाज, या दल से ऊँचा था; अगर आलोचना की जरुरत हो तो भी वे पीछे नहीं हटे, चाहे सामने नेहरू जी ही क्यों न हों, और अगर देश का आह्वान हो तो विपक्ष में होते हुए भी उन्होंने विश्व के मंच पर राष्ट्र का प्रतिनिधित्व किया और अपने राष्ट्र-धर्म का पालन किया। आवाज़, आईआईटी खड़गपुर की ओर से उन्हें कोटि-कोटि नमन और भावभीनी श्रद्धांजलि!

'क्या हार में क्या जीत में, किंचित नहीं भयभीत मैं!
कर्तव्य पथ पर जो मिला, ये भी सही वो भी सही!
वरदान नहीं मांगूंगा, हो कुछ भी पर हार नहीं मानूंगा!'

मैं जी भर जिया, मैं मन से मरूँ,
लौटकर आऊँगा, कूच से क्यों डरूँ? '

आज एक युग का अंत हो गया- भारतवर्ष के किसी एक राजनीतिक अध्याय का ही नहीं, बल्कि समग्र राष्ट्र की ओजस्विता के अध्याय का भी। भारत-रत्न स्वर्गीय अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी के निधन ने सम्पूर्ण राष्ट्र को शोक-सागर में डुबो दिया है। तीन बार देश के प्रधानमंत्री रह चुके वाजपेयीजी एक आदर्श राजनेता थे जिनकी राजनीति दलगत कभी रही ही नहीं, क्योंकि वे पूरे देश को एक साथ लेकर चलना जानते थे। संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघ में हिंदी में अपना वक्तृत्त्व देने वाले वे पहले राष्ट्र-प्रतिनिधि थे। वे एक कुशल एवं ओजस्वी वक्ता, प्रख्यात कवि एवं आदर्श पत्रकार थे, जिनका हर शब्द देश की जनता के दिल में घर कर जाता था। यही कारण है कि परमाणु परीक्षण, कारगिल युद्ध, या संसद हमले जैसे कठिन समय में भी उन्होंने कुशलता से राष्ट्र का संचालन किया और सभी पार्टियों को एक सूत्र में बाँधे रखा। स्वतंत्र भारत के राजनीतिक इतिहास में वाजपेयीजी शायद ऐसे एकमात्र राजनेता हैं जिन्हें पक्ष और विपक्ष, दोनों का समान भाव से आदर और प्रेम मिला। कारण बहुत सहज है- उनके लिए देश किसी व्यक्ति, समाज, या दल से ऊँचा नहीं था; अगर आलोचना की जरुरत हो तो भी वे पीछे नहीं हटे, चाहे सामने नेहरू जी ही क्यों न हों, और अगर देश का आह्वान हो तो विपक्ष में होते हुए भी उन्होंने विश्व के मंच पर राष्ट्र का प्रतिनिधित्व किया और अपने राष्ट्र-धर्म का पालन किया। आवाज़, आईआईटी खड़गपुर की ओर से उन्हें कोटि-कोटि नमन और भावभीनी श्रद्धांजलि!

'क्या हार में क्या जीत में, किंचित नहीं भयभीत मैं!
कर्तव्य पथ पर जो मिला, ये भी सही वो भी सही!
वरदान नहीं मांगूंगा, हो कुछ भी पर हार नहीं मानूंगा!'

short_message: As most are already aware, Kerala is facing its worst flood since 1924. The death toll has risen to 186, Red Alert has been sounded in 12 out of the 14
message:
As most are already aware, Kerala is facing its worst flood since 1924. The death toll has risen to 186, Red Alert has been sounded in 12 out of the 14 districts and 10 districts have been severely affected. Nearly Ten thousand people have been shifted to rehabilitation camps. The battle we are fighting is manifold.

Therefore, the TechKeralites (Society of Kerala Staff and students) group at IIT Kharagpur is organizing a Relief Fund Collection for the Kerala CM Distress Relief Fund. We request you to contribute generously to the affected people of the state. We would also appreciate if you could spread or share this message with others.

We thank all the people who have extended love and support in this time of devastation.

Please find the details of the account to which the financial support can be transferred.

message:
Kerala is suffering the worst flood disaster since 1924. With the official death toll rising above 80 and the estimated loss of the state in thousands of crores, Red alert has been sounded in all the 14 districts. According to the Indian Express, 85,399 people have been shifted to relief camps and the rescue teams are trying their best in helping as many as they can.

Tech Keralites, a group of students and staff of IIT Kharagpur has come forward to seek help from the KGP community for donations in the Chief Minister's Distress Fund.

short_message: India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog ( http://www.niti.gov.in /) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a
message:
India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog ( http://www.niti.gov.in /) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach:
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.... . The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi ( http://movesummit.in /) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 40 new photos — with Amul Patwa and 12 others.
short_message: Independence Day is here and the celebrations were not only limited at the Institute level. Students spread across various Halls of Residences also celebrated
message:
Independence Day is here and the celebrations were not only limited at the Institute level. Students spread across various Halls of Residences also celebrated this auspicious day in their respective Halls by hoisting the national flag and commemorating the freedom fighters and martyrs who were pivotal to India's independence. In almost all the Halls, the national flag was hoisted early in the morning by their respective wardens and assistant wardens, followed by speeches and customary sweet distribution. Here's the sneak peek into the independence day celebration at various Halls.
At RP Hall, the celebrations included distributing food packets at the school 'Disha Seema Centre' on this occasion which indeed is a nice gesture to look up to. At Azad Hall, flag hoisting was followed by tree plantation to send out a message about how important is it for us to preserve the nature to be able to enjoy this freedom in the long run. In all the halls, the Hall staff members also played a big role in arranging for the celebrations though most of them did not have their duty today.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 42 new photos.
short_message: 'Long years ago, we made a tryst with destiny, and now the time comes when we shall redeem our pledge, not wholly or in full measure, but very substantially.
message:
'Long years ago, we made a tryst with destiny, and now the time comes when we shall redeem our pledge, not wholly or in full measure, but very substantially. At the stroke of the midnight hour, when the world sleeps, India will awake to life and freedom. A moment comes, which comes but rarely in history when we step out from the old to the new when an age ends, and when the soul of a nation, long suppressed, finds utterance.' Maybe in terms of time, it has been around 72 years when they were first voiced by Jawaharlal Nehru but their importance to the entire nation is flagrant by the way independence was celebrated today at IIT Kharagpur near Bidhan Chowk in front of the main building. Although because of rain the programme was shifted from Bidhan Chowk to Netaji Auditorium after the flaring of the flag by our beloved director. The programme also witnessed various jaw-dropping performances from kids of various schools like DAV model school, Hijli High School, Jagriti Vidya Mandir, Mongrace Daycare centre as well various other schools located near the institution, those kids irrefutable won many hearts and arose patriotic feeling among the people present there. The programme was graced by the presence of Director Partha P Chakrabarti, Dean UG Sudhir Kumar Barai as well as Professor Somesh Kumar Dean, Student Affairs along with NSS and NCC volunteers.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur urges everyone to salute the nation, have freedom in the mind, faith in the words and pride in the soul.

short_message: Independence is indispensable to every one of us and it’s been 72 long years when India tasted it. All those sufferings, struggles and sacrifices bore
message:
Independence is indispensable to every one of us and it’s been 72 long years when India tasted it. All those sufferings, struggles and sacrifices bore fruit on this very day when India stood proud, moving out of the tumultuous British claws which held it for 200 long years.15th August, the Independence day of India has been a symbol of devotion, dedication and determination and today, we all stand proud of the martyrs who gave their all to make India independent.

Awaaz wishes everyone a HAPPY INDEPENDENCE DAY!

message:

short_message: AgNext, a startup by KGPians, is an agricultural sensing and solutions company that offers a platform to ideate, innovate, prototype and commercialize
message:
AgNext, a startup by KGPians, is an agricultural sensing and solutions company that offers a platform to ideate, innovate, prototype and commercialize impactful technology solutions and services for entire Agri-Value Chain. Projects involve topics related to IOT Electronics, Machine Learning, Image Processing, Full Stack Software Development, Android and Web Applications, Cloud Computing, Robotics, Product Design (CAD), Market Research and Business Development. They are looking forward to a long-term association with KGPians who are passionate about using their talents and skills for socially relevant and impactful technology solutions for Agri-Tech. Fellowship will be awarded to selected participants. Beyond handsome financial rewards, they plan to offer involvement in patents for the products you work on. Go to the link below:
https://goo.gl/forms/infc...

message:

short_message:
Hello Freshers,

We are Kharagpur Open Source Society. We are a group of open source and coding enthusiasts. Every year KOSS plans to hold events
message:
Hello Freshers,

We are Kharagpur Open Source Society. We are a group of open source and coding enthusiasts. Every year KOSS plans to hold events for familiarising students with UNIX tools, Linux environment, Git Development Workflow, besides conducting workshops on Python programming, Application development and hackathons.

KOSS also conducts Kharagpur Winter of Code which is a month-long program focused on introducing students into open source software development during the month on December.

This year too we would be organising events like Git Workshop, Ubuntu Install Fest, Introduction to Python Programming and more. Stay tuned and turn on notifications for posts from KOSS so that you do not miss any of our events.

Want to be a part of KOSS?
KOSS's introductory seminar is conducted during the Spring semester which is followed by selections for 1st-year students.
Attend our Tutorials, Workshops and keep exploring the exciting world of Open Source.

short_message: Yet another breakthrough achievement by KGPians when a team participating from IIT Kharagpur secured the Chairman Award for Technical Innovation in India
message:
Yet another breakthrough achievement by KGPians when a team participating from IIT Kharagpur secured the Chairman Award for Technical Innovation in India Innovation Challenge Design Contest (IICDC) 2017. The award was given on Battery Health Management System with Integrated Charger by Texas Instruments India(TI). The IIT Kharagpur figured on top among the 10 winning teams of one of the country's most popular design contests for engineering students.
The winners qualify for a Rs. 3.5 crore start-up seed fund from the Department of Science and Technology (DST) and an opportunity to be incubated at IIM Bangalore's innovation and entrepreneurship hub N S Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL). The final 10 winners were chosen after several rounds of discussions and deliberations by a panel of judges. Awaaz IIT Kharagpur extends it's heartiest congratulates to the winning team.
Source: https://www.ndtv.com/educ...

short_message: The MHRD has planned to launch three India-centered research schemes in the coming October, that will focus on issues of national concern and also develop
message:
The MHRD has planned to launch three India-centered research schemes in the coming October, that will focus on issues of national concern and also develop the country's research infrastructure and knowledge ecosystem. The institutions selected to pilot these schemes are IISc Bangalore, IIT Kharagpur, and India Council of Social Sciences and Research (ICSSR).

IIT Kharagpur will be coordinating the Scheme for promotion of academic & research collaboration (SPARC). The Rs 418 crore scheme seeks to boost joint research with global universities from 25 countries and get international expertise to solve major national problems, train Indian students in the best laboratories, and deepen academic engagement. The other two schemes, Impactful policy research in social science (IMPRESS) and Scheme for transformational and advanced research in fundamental sciences (STARS) will be coordinated by ICSSR and IISc Bangalore respectively.

Get more information about it here:
https://m.economictimes.c...

short_message: The IIT Kharagpur student branch of Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers(IEEE) carried out a workshop on the widely used software MATLAB in
message:
The IIT Kharagpur student branch of Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers(IEEE) carried out a workshop on the widely used software MATLAB in the 'Takshashila' building, witnessing a huge turnout of enthusiastic students who filled up the two labs. The introductory workshop was appreciated by almost all the students ranging from undergraduate freshers to a significant number of Ph.D. students as it played a helping hand to familiarize them with its commands and purposefulness. The workshop lasted for around three hours in the evening with a ten-minute break for snacks.

The student branch of IEEE also assured that they will be planning more such events whenever a considerable number of students approach them with specific topics sighting a workshop.

short_message: In order to curb the billion-dollar private coaching industry that has grown around the IIT entrance exam JEE, an ostrobogulous idea of turning the premier
message:
In order to curb the billion-dollar private coaching industry that has grown around the IIT entrance exam JEE, an ostrobogulous idea of turning the premier engineering colleges like IITs limited only to post-graduate and research-centric institutions like the IIMs instead of focusing more on undergraduates as they currently do has been put forward by a section of the faculty and alumni of the Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs). The proposal is set to be taken up for review at a meeting of the IIT council on 21st August.
Source: https://theprint.in/gover...

short_message: A lot of issues being faced by the students while surfing the web has been reported to CIC helpdesk. The head of CIC acknowledged that CIC team is now
message:
A lot of issues being faced by the students while surfing the web has been reported to CIC helpdesk. The head of CIC acknowledged that CIC team is now aware of the problems and working to resolve the issues. Hence, there is now no need for everyone to report the same problem. Few unforeseen problems are expected for some time after a major equipment migration but CIC team will resolve it. As stated earlier, there hasn't been any new restrictions placed intentionally.
Head (CIC) also wishes to inform all the students that the Youtube problem (and others problems as well) being experienced by students is an unforeseen problem arising out of a major equipment (firewall) migration in the backend yesterday evening. There are no new restrictions imposed on anything. Some problems after a major migration are common and expected. CIC will resolve it and their team is working on it. It is a bit of strange problem whose exact cause is yet to be known with full accuracy and hence, no particular time period can be quoted by which the problem will get solved, but it will be resolved very soon. Students are requested to not to worry, and not to report the problems again and again as the CIC team are now aware of it.

message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the Head (CIC) regarding the newly imposed restrictions on the internet including the 'Restricted Mode” on YouTube and found out that there has been nothing like these restrictions that have been put up intentionally by CIC. Head of the CIC said, 'There are no new restrictions placed. Two old firewalls were replaced by new ones last evening, there may be issues because of that. If students are still facing issues, they should report the exact problem to CIC helpdesk and it will be looked after.'
We would like to request you all to comment down the exact issues that you have been facing since last evening so that we can communicate them collectively to CIC helpdesk.

short_message: It has come to light that stricter network restrictions have been applied to IIT Kharagpur’s internet, the most prominent of these being the enabling of
message:
It has come to light that stricter network restrictions have been applied to IIT Kharagpur’s internet, the most prominent of these being the enabling of “Restricted Mode” on Youtube. Restricted Mode not only prevents any and all videos that may be deemed explicit or mature from being viewed, but also disables comments on all youtube videos. This has had the probably unintended consequence of removing many popular music videos, which have been regrettably deemed “inappropriate” for a demographic aged 18- 23. A number of other websites, such as movie streaming site fmovies and social media platform 9gag have also been blocked.

We at Scholars’ Avenue are making efforts to get more concrete information from official sources, since no communication has taken place with the student body.

short_message: Another astonishing milestone achieved by IIT Kharagpur and this time it is in the field of Bioelectronics. The team working at Bioelectronics Innovation
message:
Another astonishing milestone achieved by IIT Kharagpur and this time it is in the field of Bioelectronics. The team working at Bioelectronics Innovation Laboratory has developed coin-sized biological chips for rehabilitation and prostheses applications. As per Prof Sudip Nag these chips would solve neural connectivity problems that are not addressed by the latest medical sciences and would also escalate the lifetime of implants reducing the number of surgical interventions. Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team for its stupefying achievement. For further information one can follow the given link :
https://www.newsheads.in/...

short_message: In what comes as an astonishing result for IIT Kharagpur athletics, men's 4x100 relay team of Eslavath Jaga Deesh, Shivam Singh, Sairam Alla and Lokesh
message:
In what comes as an astonishing result for IIT Kharagpur athletics, men's 4x100 relay team of Eslavath Jaga Deesh, Shivam Singh, Sairam Alla and Lokesh Reddi clocked 44.4 seconds bagging the bronze medal in the State Athletics Championship at the Salt Lake Stadium on Saturday.

The medal came on the penultimate day of the meet and is the first ever medal of IIT-KGP in the state championship in just their second appearance. 14 participants represented the IIT Kharagpur team and despite difficulties in practice due to track renovation, the athletes have given their very best.

For more information, check out this link- https://www.telegraphindi...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the athletics team, their coach Mr. Pranab Sarkar and all the people behind the institute's healthy sports culture for this remarkable feat that would set a standard for more sporting glory in the future.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 3 new photos.
short_message:
Day 2 | Assimilation Programme

The Day-2 of the Central Events of the Assimilation Programme 2018 took place today at the Netaji Auditorium.
message:
Day 2 | Assimilation Programme

The Day-2 of the Central Events of the Assimilation Programme 2018 took place today at the Netaji Auditorium. Due to a staggering turnout of less than 10%, the event had to be postponed by at least half an hour, when the quorum was finally met. The first session, 'Motivational Lecture-II' had Dr Era Dutta, a consultant, neuropsychiatrist, therapist, and a life coach from Kolkata involving the students in an interactive talk about Success and Depression. With statistics and examples, the students explored the pervasive traits of depression, its correspondence with success and its cure, the happiness. 'Happiness is the whole pie and we are focusing only on success which is just a small chunk. Why not focus on the whole pie?', she said. The session thus ended with her advice to this post-millennial audience, which was to keep chanting a happiness mantra, 'Today was a good day.'

By 7:15, the strength has already increased to about 300 for the latter event of the day, 'Carrer Workshop-2' conducted by the External Relations Cell and the CDC. In continuation to the CV filling workshop of last week, this session involved an insight into various opportunities available for an undergraduate student at IIT Kharagpur. Four sectors viz., Higher Studies, Public Sector, Corporate Sector, and Entrepreneurship sector were discussed. Students were given a rough outline of how it is to choose one of them and implement accordingly a set of plans, internships to do and courses to undertake. At around quarter past eight, the day ended and as anticipated by most of the people, no attendance was taken.

short_message:
साहित्य के सितारे । श्री मैथिलीशरण गुप्त

“राष्ट्रकवि” मैथिलीशरण गुप्त का जन्म सन् 1886 में आज ही के दिन झाँसी, उत्तर प्रदेश में हुआ। उस वक़्त
message:
साहित्य के सितारे । श्री मैथिलीशरण गुप्त

“राष्ट्रकवि” मैथिलीशरण गुप्त का जन्म सन् 1886 में आज ही के दिन झाँसी, उत्तर प्रदेश में हुआ। उस वक़्त ब्रजभाषा के लोकप्रिय होने के बावजूद गुप्त ने अपनी रचनाओं में खड़ी बोली का उपयोग कर अपने मन के भावों का सटीक और सजीव चित्रण किया। इसी कारण उनका स्थान खड़ी बोली के जनकों में शिखर पर माना जाता है। रामायण, महाभारत और बौद्ध साहित्य के किरदार उनकी अधिकतर रचनाओं में मुख्य भूमिका में हैं। यह धार्मिक जुड़ाव उनके विचारों को एक नया आयाम देता रहा जिसका लोग सदैव स्वागत करते रहे।

‘पंचवटी’, ‘साकेत’, ‘जयद्रथ वध’, ‘यशोधरा’, ‘द्वापर’, ‘झंकार’, ‘जयभारत’ उनकी कुछ विशिष्ट काव्य रचनाओं में से हैं। ‘अनघ’, ‘चन्द्रहास’, ‘तिलोत्तमा’, ‘निष्क्रिय प्रतिरोध’ और ‘विसर्जन’ उनके द्वारा लिखे मौलिक नाटक हैं। इसके अलावा उन्होनें कई लोकप्रिय बाल कवितायेँ भी लिखी हैं।

गुप्त जी के काव्य में राष्ट्रीयता और गांधीवाद की प्रधानता है। इसमें भारत के गौरवमय अतीत के इतिहास और भारतीय संस्कृति की महत्ता की प्रस्तुति है। उन्होंने 1912 में भारत दर्शन की एक लाजवाब काव्यात्मक प्रस्तुति “भारत-भारती' में दी। उनकी इस रचना ने देश की तत्कालीन दुर्दशा के समाधान बताते हुए स्वदेश प्रेम को एक नयी आवाज़ दी और स्वतंत्रता संग्राम के दौरान देशवासियों ने भी उनके सुर में सुर मिलाए। इसी कारण महात्मा गांधी ने उन्हें 'राष्ट्रकवि' की पदवी भी दी थी।

1954 में पद्म भूषण से सम्मानित और राज्य सभा के सदस्य रहे गुप्त जी ने तुक के बिना भी जो धुन लोगों के ह्रदय तक पहुँचाई हम उसे नमन करते हैं और यह आशा करते हैं कि आने वाली हर पीढ़ी तक उनकी रचनाओं का भावार्थ सफलतापूर्वक पहुंचता रहे।

It has come to our notice that several phishing mail or whatsapp messages are in circulation on campus. It may ask you to enter the ERP login credentials or your personal details. Please do not provide any information on these malicious sites. These sites/software/browser extensions are possibly capturing your secret data, for misuse, which you should not share/disclose with anybody.

Before entering the ERP login credentials, please make sure that you are browsing the valid site ( https://erp.iitkgp.ac.in /). In addition, ERP is also in process of implementing a mobile app (IIT KGP ERP) which may ask for the ERP login credentials. It's always recommended to change your ERP login credentials at regular intervals.

Thanks,

ERP Team
IIT Kharagpur

short_message: Publicis.Sapient would like to invite final year students of IIT Kharagpur to JumpStart (Sapient Premiere), a two day thought leadership and Innovation
message:
Publicis.Sapient would like to invite final year students of IIT Kharagpur to JumpStart (Sapient Premiere), a two day thought leadership and Innovation event aimed at aspiring minds in engineering.
Publicis.Sapient, the digital business transformation hub of Publicis Groupe, helps clients drive growth and efficiency and evolve the ways they work, in a world where consumer behavior and technology are catalyzing social and commercial changes at an unprecedented pace. With 17,000 people and over 100 offices around the globe, our expertise spanning technology, data sciences, consulting and creative, combined with our culture of innovation, enables us to deliver on complex transformation initiatives that accelerate our clients’ businesses through creating the products and services their customers expect. One can visit www.publicis.sapient.com for more information
JumpStart is a two-day thought-leadership-and-innovation event aimed at aspiring minds in engineering from the topmost colleges across the country. It aims at introducing these students to the real world of technology, exposing them to upcoming career trends and giving them a jumpstart to exciting careers across a wide range of fields. Organised by Sapient on August 25-26 at Bengaluru and September 01-02 at Gurugram, JumpStart will also include an all-expenses-paid travel, a stay at a luxurious hotel and numerous fun activities.
1. The primary objective of JumpStart is to introduce students to the applications of modern-day technology to the problems in the real world. They will get insights into innovative uses of these technologies to accelerate businesses and solve problems across industries.
2. The event includes an exclusive exhibition demonstrating marvels of technology developed by industry experts and innovative solutions to problems that slow down the growth of businesses with Big Data, API, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Experience Technology and more.
3. Students will get to know about different career options across a number of fields. We want to use this event as a platform to bust numerous career-related myths that deter students from making wise career decisions
4. JumpStart will be an opportunity for them to interact with fellow engineers from across the country and establish networks that will help them grow as professionals later in their lives.
5. JumpStart is about learning - we want students to become the best at what they want to do. It is not just an information-broadcasting event, it also focuses on using interactions among the participants for idea exchange.
To attend JumpStart, a Hackathon will be conducted. To register, visit this link: https://goo.gl/1JkMCG. The Hackathon talk will be conducted on 6th August from 7.30 PM, along with the internship talk.
All prefinal and final year students are advised to attend the talk.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Prajwal Singhania and Shubham Jena.
short_message:
Chandralekha Singh (KGP 1988) & Jeremy Levy Student Excellence Award
Prajwal Singhania and Shubham Jena have been awarded the Chandralekha Singh (KGP
message:
Chandralekha Singh (KGP 1988) & Jeremy Levy Student Excellence Award
Prajwal Singhania and Shubham Jena have been awarded the Chandralekha Singh (KGP 1988) & Jeremy Levy Student Excellence Award instituted to recognize and support the excellence in academics. The awards will be conferred on the Foundation Day to Shubham Jena and Prajwal Singhania.
Dr Chandralekha Singh [1988/MSc/PH/SN] and her husband Dr Jeremy Levy are professors at the University of Pittsburgh in the USA. The awards will be in the memory of Prof Mandakini Majumdar (Deshpande), who was a pioneer as one of the first women engineers to serve as a professor in the Civil Engineering Dept of IIT Kharagpur and in the honor of Prof G P Sastry of the Physics Dept of IIT Kharagpur, writer of several textbooks and known as a very popular teacher. For Prof. Singh and Prof. Levy, who themselves are academicians at the University of Pittsburgh, USA, these are legacies of teacher-student rapport of a close-knit campus like IIT Kharagpur.
This award has facilitated by the IIT KGP Foundation USA. The Foundation earlier facilitated donations for funded foreign internships and a Hi-Tech ambulance for the students.

short_message: An interactive talk is being organised by the Corporate & Media Interaction (CMI) Cell of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur with the speaker
message:
An interactive talk is being organised by the Corporate & Media Interaction (CMI) Cell of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur with the speaker being Shri Ravi Kant (Ex Vice Chairman – Tata Motors and Distinguished Alumnus & Professor – IIT KGP).
Date: 02-August-2018 (Thursday)
Time: 3:30 – 4:30 PM
Venue: F-116, Main Building (Bhatnagar Auditorium)
Topic of the talk: How Robotics and Artificial Intelligence is Shaping the Future of Work and Impacting Society
Mr. Ravi Kant will also be available for meeting individually during 03-08-2018, 11:00 AM. Write to in case you’d like to meet him.

Profile of the speaker: Mr. Ravi Kant, B. Tech. (Hons.), M.Sc., D.Sc. (Hon) served as the Managing Director of Tata Motors Limited. He has a Bachelor of Technology degree from Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, MS in Industry from Aston University and Honorary D.Sc from Aston University. He is an Honorary Industrial Professor at the University of Warwick, UK and was awarded the BMA Management Man of the Year Award 2008-09. He serves as Chairman of Indian Institute of Management Rohtak; Tata Advanced Materials Ltd and TAL Manufacturing Solutions Ltd. He has been a Non-Executive Independent Director of Vedanta Limited since January 29, 2015 and served as its Non-Executive Director since January 28, 2014 until January 29, 2015. He is a Director of National Institute of Design (India) and Enactus (USA) and WonderWork (USA). Mr. Kant is credited with the successful and unexpected turnaround of the once-struggling luxury units, Jaguar Land Rover, bought from Ford Motor Company in 2008. He also played an instrumental role in the development and subsequent launch of world’s cheapest car Nano six years ago. He championed the development of the Tata Ace, still running as India’s biggest selling mini truck. He also played a crucial role in the acquisition of Daewoo Commercial Vehicle Company in 2004. After giving up active participation in running the day-to-day affairs of Tata in 2009, he gradually slipped into the role of a mentor and also a consultant.)

short_message: The Corporate & Media Interaction (CMI) Cell of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur is organising an interactive talk with the speaker being
message:
The Corporate & Media Interaction (CMI) Cell of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur is organising an interactive talk with the speaker being Shri Mritunjay Kumar Tiwary (Founder, Trustee, and Head of Projects – Akhand Jyoti Eye Hospital)
Date: 01-August-2018 (Wednesday)
Time: 5:00 – 6:00 PM
Venue: #116, Main Building (Bhatnagar Auditorium)
Tentative topic: Social Entrepreneurship and Business Ventures at the Bottom of the Pyramid
Mritunjay Kumar Tiwary is the founder & Head of Projects at the Akhand Jyoti Eye Hospital, Mastichak, Bihar, which has now become one of the top 5 eye hospitals in India. He started the project with a strong belief that eye-health delivered innovatively can alleviate poverty, improve gender parity and enhance social capital in the low-income states of India. The hospital offers world-class eye care services, including all sub-specialties, and perform over 65,000 surgeries annually, 80% free, and in the process, impacts the lives of 1 million people every year.
He also works actively to provide equal opportunities to girls from rural Bihar by running the unique ‘Football To Eyeball’ talent creation initiative at the eye hospital which aims to tackle child marriage and gender inequality by providing an alternative to girls. 140 girls have now reclaimed their lives with 30 girls added to the scheme every year. Mritunjay was given the Reliance – CNN IBN REAL HEROES AWARD in 2010 for this initiative.

short_message: Here's an important message to the student community from the desk of Dean (Student Affairs) regarding the potential strike that can begin from 5th August.
message:
Here's an important message to the student community from the desk of Dean (Student Affairs) regarding the potential strike that can begin from 5th August.

Dear Students,

There is a threat of an imminent strike by the outsourced mess workers of some of the halls where contractual employees are working. They may be supported by other contractual workers of the halls too. Already there is stoppage of work by some of these workers in the messes. The Institute administration is trying to handle the issue with the help of the district administration.

At this point we need cooperation from all students to overcome this situation. Arrangements are being made to have restricted cooking. The breakfast may be in packed form. The lunch and dinner may be cooked with the help of regular mess employees who will work extra time after completing the work in their respective halls. The campus community may also help in providing the food in halls. Institute administration is working out strategies to face the situation.

It is imperative that all the regular activities of the institute such as classes, labs, tests, co-curricular and extra-curricular will continue as usual. The students are advised not to enter into any kind of altercation with the employees. It is important that the student community shows its resilience in the face of adversity. Hall presidents and other hall council members will provide necessary guidance in the matter. The student leaders and the Institute authorities may be approached anytime in case of any difficulty related to this.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTICE FROM THE DEAN OF STUDENT AFFAIRS (DOSA)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Students,

There is a threat of an imminent strike by the outsourced mess workers of some of the halls where contractual employees are working. They may be supported by other contractual workers of the halls too. Already there is stoppage of work by some of these workers in the messes. The Institute administration is trying to handle the issue with the help of the district administration.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
short_message: The very first day of the Assimilation program carried out by the  Student representatives of the TSG and Halls, turned out to be what can be said a remarkable
message:
The very first day of the Assimilation program carried out by the Student representatives of the TSG and Halls, turned out to be what can be said a remarkable start of a future-shaping program. The Sunday morning started with the basic introduction about Assimilation Program along with clearing off some doubts and rumors about this program. It was then followed by the description of upcoming Inter IIT competitions by the Gymkhana representatives. The Inter IIT Cultural, Sports and Technology student representatives explained students about the details of all these areas and possible ways to explore them.
The second program of the day conducted by the External Relations Cell received a great response from the students' side. The program 'How to build a CV ' and 'Understanding GDs and Pis' mainly focused on the different fields that come under a CV. It gave a brief idea about how to build a CV including the do's and don'ts while formulating the CV.
The final program 'Student Welfare Portfolio' described a typical life of a student when in mental pressure and a friend's role in his or her life.
Awaaz encourages second years students to participate in these programmes and make the most out of it.
If you still have any queries regarding the Assimilation program, you can visit here. https://medium.com/@awaaz...

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 3 new photos.
short_message:
Day 1 | Phase 2 | Assimilation Programme

The second phase of Day 1 of the Assimilation Programme 2018 had the ExR cell and the SWG taking over
message:
Day 1 | Phase 2 | Assimilation Programme

The second phase of Day 1 of the Assimilation Programme 2018 had the ExR cell and the SWG taking over the stage of Kalidas Auditorium to conduct some interesting and useful workshops. Despite a low turnover, the programme began only a little off-scheduled at 6:20 in the evening.

The session started with Somil Gupta and Raghav Jalan of the External Relations Cell conducting a workshop on CV-building. All the key essentials of a CV and a cover letter were discussed here. There was a brief overview of the format, signature and some useful browser extensions while sending a mail, and the protocol to be followed while taking telephonic and personal interviews. It was 7:40 by the time the workshop ended. Despite SWG's portents of upcoming attendance-check, almost half of the already fewer students started leaving for their hostels.

The session however continued with Abhrajit Saha and Ruchin Raj of the Institute Wellness Group elaborating on the establishment and ideals of IWG. There was then, a display of around 10 popular KGP themed memes. This was shortly followed by a short picture story of a lonely KGP boy facing mental stigma and his prospects of living in the presence and absence of friends. The anecdote then moved on to elucidate the importance and reliability of the Counselling Centre. Then, there was an introduction to YourDOST and a funny demonstration on the working of its interface through a fake YourDOST id 'Spidy69.' When the counsellor messaged 'Hey, can I call you Spidy?', the user replied, 'Where is the 69?.' Abrajit even said, 'Make use of it. Afterall, the institute pays them 13.5 lakh a year.'

With this, the session ended and no attendance was taken.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
short_message:
Assimilation Program | Day 1

TL;DR Attendance was taken.

The first scheduled program of Assimilation program started with Krushi
message:
Assimilation Program | Day 1

TL;DR Attendance was taken.

The first scheduled program of Assimilation program started with Krushi Bandi addressing the gathering about what Assimilation program was. He mentioned that the Assimilation Program was completely different from OP in a sense that all the activities would be monitored and recorded officially. He also spoke about how the app developed exclusively for the purpose of the program would be helpful to the sophomores. In case of any mishaps, all one has to do is post a complaint through the app and the issue would be resolved within 24 hours. He also stressed that the attending the Hall Assimilation is mandatory and one has to submit a written letter of absence to the hall president or the warden in case one misses out due to unavoidable circumstances.

Harsh Kumar Sharan, Deputy Contingent leader of InterIIT Cultural team, gave an introduction about cultural events and our records on the previous two Inter IIT competitions. He also gave an in short note on all the events and how one could get a position for themselves in the Inter IIT contingent. Harsh asked all sophomores present to work on their skills and on a lighter note, he added, “You can’t become captains in your second year because you suck at everything you do”.

The session was followed by the general secretaries, sports and games, who gave us an introduction to the sports culture in KGP. There was an after movie of past year InterIIT Sports Meet and performance of IIT KGP was discussed. They encouraged all sophomores to get their feet onto the field so that the thirteen-year draught would end (context: the last time we won at InterIIT sports meet was in 2005). Ways to make it to the contingent were discussed.

The final discussion about Tech events was more cheerful, thanks to our remarkable performance in Inter IIT Tech meets. All of the events that were conducted last year was discussed in detail. The selection procedure and preparation methods for the same were also discussed.

It is important to note that fair and transparent selections for most events were promised by the secretaries and assured the students that the notion that only people from certain societies could participate (which most people held) was false.

The next half of the program is scheduled at 6 PM, today at Kalidas.

short_message:
Assimilation Program | Day 1

TL;DR Attendance was taken.

The first scheduled program of Assimilation program started with Krushi
message:
Assimilation Program | Day 1

TL;DR Attendance was taken.

The first scheduled program of Assimilation program started with Krushi Bandi addressing the gathering about what Assimilation programming. He mentioned that the Assimilation Program was completely different from OP in a sense that all the activities would be monitored and recorded officially. He also spoke about how the app developed exclusively for the purpose of the program would be helpful to the sophomores. In case of any mishaps, all one has to do is post a complaint through the app and the issue would be resolved within 24 hours. He also stressed that the attending the Hall Assimilation is mandatory and one has to submit a written letter of absence to the hall president or the warden in case one misses out due to unavoidable circumstances.

Harsh Kumar Sharan, Deputy Contingent leader of InterIIT Cultural team, gave an introduction about cultural events and our records on the previous two Inter IIT competitions. He also gave an in short note on all the events and how one could get a position for themselves in the Inter IIT contingent. Harsh asked all sophomores present to work on their skills and on a lighter note, he added, “You can’t become captains in your second year because you suck at everything you do”.

The session was followed by the general secretaries, sports and games, who gave us an introduction to the sports culture in KGP. There was an after movie of past year InterIIT Sports Meet and performance of IIT KGP was discussed. They encouraged all sophomores to get their feet onto the field so that the thirteen-year draught would end (context: the last time we won at InterIIT sports meet was in 2005). Ways to make it to the contingent were discussed.

The final discussion about Tech events was more cheerful, thanks to our remarkable performance in Inter IIT Tech meets. All of the events that were conducted last year was discussed in detail. The selection procedure and preparation methods for the same were also discussed.

It is important to note that fair and transparent selections for most events were promised by the secretaries and assured the students that the notion that only people from certain societies could participate (which most people held) was false.

The next half of the program is scheduled at 6 PM, today at Kalidas.

short_message: The penultimate day of the induction programme witnessed inspiring lectures from Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, Director, IIT Kharagpur and Mr. Mir Ranjan
message: The penultimate day of the induction programme witnessed inspiring lectures from Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, Director, IIT Kharagpur and Mr. Mir Ranjan Negi, former goalkeeper of Indian National field hockey team in addition to the regular physical activities and department visits. Mr. Negi's career was the inspiration behind the 2007 hit film Chak De India. He talked about how he was evicted from mainstream hockey, but he was committed to take Indian hockey to new heights. His life is the perfect example of dedication and determination empowering a person to achieve the unachievable and answer the unanswerable. Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, in his welcome address to the freshers, talked about the academic excellence of IIT Kharagpur as an institute and the opportunities that the students get here be it in any department or stream of study.

short_message: Rajit Karmakar, a Ph.D. Scholar in the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious
message:
Rajit Karmakar, a Ph.D. Scholar in the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious Richard E. Merwin Scholarship this year. Under this scholarship, IEEE Computer Society offers $40,000 in student scholarships from $1,000 and up to recognize and reward active student volunteer leaders in student branches or chapters who show promise in their academic and professional efforts. His primary research interest is Hardware Security and VLSI Testing. He has completed his MS degree from the same department at IIT Kharagpur in the year 2015.
He has been a graduate student member of IEEE for the past three years. He is also a student member of IEEE Computer Society and IEEE Circuit and Systems Society. Starting as any other student member, he served IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur in the capacity of Student Activity Committee (SAC) member (2016), Chair, IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur (2017), and currently, he is serving as the University Partnership Program (UPP) Liaison, IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur (2018).
During these years of his association with IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur, they have organized several workshops (technical/ non-technical), technical talks by distinguished lecturers from all over the world, organizing conferences, partially supported IEEE Student members to attend conferences and lot more. IEEE TechSym 2016 was one such major event that was highly successful. He believes this award/scholarship is a recognization of his hard work and dedication towards IEEE activities throughout the last few years. (FInd out about their activities here: https://goo.gl/iT2UBB )
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Rajit for bagging this scholarship and believes that the efforts being put by IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur is commendable. They deserve all the appreciation.
Scholarship details: https://www.computer.org/...

Discussions based on various life-skills and creative practices were held under the guidance of skilled practice trainers, faculty mentors and advisors. A beautiful display of Kalighat Paintings at a room in Nalanda was the cynosure of all eyes. To have a basic idea of their chosen stream, the students were guided to their departments where they interacted with their respective HODs and faculty members.

short_message: The second day of the Induction Programme unfolded with the stress-busting Physical activities like yoga and aerobics which were performed by the visibly
message:
The second day of the Induction Programme unfolded with the stress-busting Physical activities like yoga and aerobics which were performed by the visibly enthusiastic freshers under the supervision of trainers in Nalanda and Tata sports complex. Life skills and creative practices involving things such as music value-based discussions and dance were introduced to the different groups of freshers.

The second day witnessed two sessions of speeches in Netaji Auditorium. In the morning session, Technology Students' Gymkhana President Prof. William Mohanty and Vice President, Vishal Kumar Singh illustrated the importance of extracurricular activities to the curious crowd which was present. Later in the day, Prof. Swagata Dasgupta, Asso-Dean, Continuing Education and Prof. Anindya Sarkar, Head, Geology and Geophysics gave inspirational talks on career, self-growth and frontiers of science and technology. A hall introduction is planned at night to cap off a versatile day two for the freshers.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages all the freshers to utilize the various aspects of induction and do not hesitate to ask us a query related to any campus-related activities. Follow our page and website( www.awaaziitkgp.org ) to stay updated!

IIT Kharagpur's six-day induction programme kicked off today with the introduction to the history of IIT-KGP. Following it, academic structure and opportunities were illustrated by Prof. Sudhir K. Barai, Dean(UG). Similar career talks were also given in the evening by Prof. Pallab Dasgupta, Dean, SRIC and Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Asso-Dean, SRIC.
The striking feature of today's activity though was the YourDost overview given in Netaji Auditorium to which the anxious freshers listened with keen attention. The day concluded with some physical activity for one of the groups.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, wishes all the freshers very best for exploring activities and interaction through the induction program. In case of any query, feel free to contact us on our facebook page or our website(awaaziitkgp.org). Stay tuned for further updates in and around the campus!

short_message: Service staff of the Institute protested in front of the Hall Managment Centre. The protesters included mess workers and sanitary workers. They demanded
message:
Service staff of the Institute protested in front of the Hall Managment Centre. The protesters included mess workers and sanitary workers. They demanded that there be an increase in their wages.
'I know workers from other IITs who earn a lot more than we do. They make nearly 18000 a month whereas we make around 8000 a month' said a protester.
The protesters also threatened to stop offering services in case their demands are not met.
'We will discontinue our services from the 5th of August if our demands are not met. Everybody, including the sweeping staff, mess staff and even the cleaning staff that is responsible for hygiene in washrooms, will not show up for work, in protest. It is the student community that will perhaps face the maximum brunt of the protest. This could easily be avoided if the institute accepts our demands and pays us our rightful wages from the money it collects from students in the form of fees. Students from other IITs pay a similar fee but the workers get paid a lot more there' opined some protesters.
We hope that this issue is resolved before any inconveniences arise.
